Trial_Design.evidence: a total of 32 extremities with rest pain or tissue loss requiring BKA will be enrolled

Participants.evidence: 32 extremities with rest pain or tissue loss requiring BKA

Intervention.evidence: intramuscular (IM) injections of allogeneic MSCs (CHAMP, n=16) or autogenous concentrated bone marrow aspirate (cBMA, marrowCHAMP, n=16)

Objective.evidence: Objective: Currently, there are no accepted nonsurgical therapies which improves the delivery of blood-derived nutrients to patients with critical limb ischemia (CLI).

Method_Outcome.evidence: Clinical limb perfusion pre- and post-treatment will be quantified using TcPO 2 , TBI, ABI, and indocyanine angiography (ICA).

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: subjects are randomized to BKA at four timepoints post-injection (days 3, 7, 14, 21)

Number_Randomised.evidence: Enrollment is underway with ten patients treated per protocol thus far.
